text:
I need to declare a filelist with an empty "dir" because the files are on
multiple volumes.

The following example:

<filelist dir="" id="peralex.libs">
  <file name="V:\HashTable.jar" />
  <file name="Z:\PDFSLibs.jar" />
</filelist>

<copy todir="C:\" overwrite="true" flatten="true" preservelastmodified="true">
  <filelist refid="peralex.libs" />
</copy>

Fails with a message like:

Z:\GRJ8000BuildScript.xml:406: The following error occurred while executing this
line:
Z:\GRJ8000BuildScript.xml:249: Failed to copy Z:\V:\HashTable.jar to C:
\HashTable.jar due to java.io.FileNotFoundException Z:\V:\HashTable.jar (The
filename, directory name, or volume label syntax is incorrect)
creator: noelgrandin@gmail.com
peterreilly@apache.org
text:
The filelist manual  page says:
"""
Multiple files are specified as a list of files, relative to the specified
directory.
"""
Since windows does not have the concept of a root directory
you cannot use filelist in the mode you ask for.
Please send an email to ant user mailling
list on how to use ant 1.7.0 file resources
which can do what you want.
